en: Maya Angelous reads her inspiration poem "And Still I Rise." Her poem focuses on the resistance that African Americans have had in the face of colonial oppression.

body.value: Everyone in the world is going to bed one night or another with fear or pain or loss or disappointment
And yet each of us has awakened or risen
Uh, somehow has made our ablution seeing other human beings and said “morning, how are you?” Fine, thanks and you?”
Is amazing. And wherever that abides in the human being there is the nobleness of the human spirit.
despite it all, Black and White, Asain, Spanish, Native American, pretty, plain, thin, fat.
You may write me down in history,
You may trod me in the very dirt
But still, like dust, I’ll rise.
Why are you beset with gloom?
Just cause I walk as if I’ve got oil wells pumping in my living room.
Just like suns and like moons with the certainty of tides,
Did you want to see me broken?
Don’t take it so hard just cause I laugh as if I have gold mines diggin’ in my own backyard.
You can shoot me with your words,
You can cut me with your lies,
You can kill me with your hatefulness,
Aw, does it come as a surprise that I dance
As if I have a diamond at the meeting of my thighs.
Out of the huts of history's shame I rise,
Up from a past rooted in pain, I rise
A black ocean, leaping and wide,
Welling and swelling, I bear in the tide.
Leaving behind nights of terror and fear, I rise.
Into a daybreak mircalously clear, I rise.
Bring the gifts that my ancestors gave, I am the dream and the hope of the slave.
Bubbly sound effects are followed by upbeat music. The lighting on set is very dim and soft, melancholic parody
"I was working in the lab one night, when my eyes beheld an eerie sight. For my monster from his nap began to rise, and suddenly, to my suprise," Ross Higgins sings with expressive vocals.
"He did the mash! He did the monster mash. The monster mash! It was a graveyard smash. He did the mash! He caught on in a flash. He did the mash! He did the monster mash"

The mood of the music video is very humorous as kids are dressed up as the classic monsters and Ross Higgins impersonating a scientist. Background visuals have cartoonish monsters, skeletons, and halloween decor.
The color scheme is pastel, giving a nostalgic feel
"The Zombies were having fun. The party had just begun. The guest included the Wolfman, Dracula, and his son."
There is a choreographed part performed by kids. There are a lot of fade-in and crossfade camera transitions.

"What ever happened to my Transylvanian twist?" Ross Higgins impersonated Dracula with a strong Transylvanian accent while the kid mouths the lyrics. The kids' interaction with the "spooky " environment makes the video humorous.
The kids dance to the chorus, and they are dressed in Halloween colors:  purple, greens, orange, black, grey.
"Now everything's cool, tracks of the band, and my monster mash is the hit of the land. For you, the living, this mash was made too. When you get to my door, tell them Boris sent you."
The song ends with an abrupt cut to the ABC for Kids logo.
